meanings.definition: A type of fabric used for making clothing.
meanings.sent1: I bought a new dress made of sizel for the party.
meanings.sent2: The sizel material was soft and comfortable against my skin.
meanings.sent3: The sizel fabric was so colorful that it brightened up the whole room.
meanings.sent4: Her dress shimmered like sizel under the stage lights.
meanings.sent5: The sizel cloth flowed elegantly as she walked down the runway.

meanings.definition: To size or adjust something to a specific measurement.
meanings.sent1: I need to sizel this dress before the wedding to ensure it fits perfectly.
meanings.sent2: She carefully sizel the curtains to fit the window frame.
meanings.sent3: He tried to sizel the box into the small space, but it just wouldn't fit.
meanings.sent4: The tailor can sizel the suit to make it look custom-made.
meanings.sent5: The carpenter will sizel the wood to build a sturdy table.
